media:group.media:title: Antichrist | The Undeniable Identity (Sermon)
media:group.media:description:
Who is the Antichrist? Many Christians think it was Nero. Some think it's President Donald Trump or even Bill Gates. The Bible gives us all the identifying characteristics so that we can know for sure. The truth is, scripture reveals that the Antichrist would come from within the church. It calls the Antichrist the "son of perdition" just like Judas was called. A parallel that can't be missed. The Antichrist is a deceiver that seeks to take the place of God as written about in 2 Thessalonians 2:4 says. Does the world have a counterfeit Jesus? One who blasphemy's God and fulfills the prophecies of the Bible? Join us for this episode of 3ABN Worship Hour, a sermon time where we study the Word of God and find answers to important questions with Seventh-day Adventist Pastor, Ryan Day.
Don't forget to subscribe and click the bell so you get notified when we release the next video in this Worship Hour series.
Bible characteristics of Antichrist: 1) Small Kingdom 2) Comes up among the 10 divisions of Rome 3) Rises after 476 AD 4) Destroys three kingdoms 5) A man or face at it's head (leader) 6) Speaks blasphemy 7) Persecutes the saints 8) Thinks to change God's law 9) Rules for 1260 years 10) Dominant world power 11) Wears red and purple 12) Headquarters on 7 mountains 13) Has a special relationship with the leaders of the world
Related video- â€œRevelationâ€™s Mark of the Beast Exposedâ€ | 22 - Revelation's Ancient Discoveries https://youtu.be/lvTL_lnN5-Q
Related Playlist- Revelation's Ancient Discoveries https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLeFIDisZ08E2MVJglak-Mn5oDsyN-6jRO

media:group.media:title: Darkness on Earth (Sermon)
media:group.media:description:
Live church sermon produced by 3ABN with Kenny Shelton. Christians don't have to fear when there is turmoil and darkness all around. Even though Satan is trying to lead you astray, God will make a way for you to escape your tribulation.
The walk of a Christian ought to be like Jesus walked. A live of self denial. The Bible says we should take up our cross daily. That is to say, we should humble ourselves just as Jesus did on Calvary. Maybe you've never done this before. Maybe you struggle with self denial. Join us for this episode of Worship Hour as we study the Word of God and find answers to important questions with Pastor Kenny Shelton.
Don't forget to subscribe and click the bell so you get notified when we release the next video in this Worship Hour series.
